title: Update regarding Nexus Software
story_body:
Nexus Software's local presence remains steady, with its downtown Denver office continuing to serve as a hub for the company's western region operations. The office, which employs around 120 staff members, has been a fixture in the city's tech scene since its opening in 2015.

In recent weeks, NXS has been actively engaging with the local community, participating in Denver's annual TechFest event and hosting a series of workshops for local startups. The company's marketing team has also been working closely with the City of Denver's economic development office to promote the city's growing tech industry.

On the personnel front, NXS has announced the promotion of longtime employee, Emily Chen, to the role of senior manager of business development. Chen, a Denver native and University of Colorado graduate, has been with the company for over 8 years and has played a key role in building relationships with local businesses and organizations.

In terms of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) initiatives, NXS has been working to reduce its carbon footprint through a series of sustainability-focused projects. The company has implemented a recycling program at its Denver office and has begun exploring options for renewable energy sources.

As part of its community outreach efforts, NXS has also partnered with the Denver Public Schools system to launch a coding education program for local high school students. The program, which is set to launch in the fall, aims to provide students with hands-on experience in software development and data analysis.

Overall, NXS remains committed to its role as a responsible corporate citizen in the Denver community, and continues to prioritize initiatives that promote local economic growth, environmental sustainability, and social responsibility.
